title: If writing answers does not generate any amount on Quora, then why do people write answers rather than just asking questions? - Quora

response.answer_text: If that is the case, Quora would remain just Qu with only questions being asked. Quora actually stands for asking questions and getting answers from people across the platform. There are many benefits of writing answers It helps in knowledge transfer. People transfer their knowledge or expertise in their field to others who want to know itAnswers on certain topics are also a means to express one’s opinion on the particular topicThere are many people who love writing and have writing as their hobby. For them Quora is a boonSome people want to improve their language skills . So they writeThis is not a platform to earn money or attention but to gain knowledge and express thoughts and opinions confidently and honestly

It's true,if one receives nothing as remuneration, honourarium, then why do people spend their time and energy and money on recharging phones and charges for accessing internet etc. But once they start to answer the question belonging to the field of their interests,it become their habit. They are addict to the practice. At least, in my case,though I don't receive any money but I find a kind of satisfaction of utilizing leisure in answering the questions, clearing the doubts of the people may be facing genuine difficulties in the subjects. It may be somewhat way of spending free time to the people advanced in age as I have been. There is no price for the favourable things or interest of one.
